goal.core.program.actions

Class SendAction

  • java.lang.Object
    • goal.parser.ParsedObject
      • goal.core.program.actions.Action
        • goal.core.program.actions.MentalAction
          • goal.core.program.actions.SendAction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IParsedObject, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<ParsedObject>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    SendOnceAction

    public class SendAction
extends MentalAction
    Sends a message to one or more Agents.

    A Selector is used to indicate to which agent(s) the message should be sent.

    A message can have a SentenceMood and has content. The content of a message is represented as a DatabaseFormula as it should be possible to store a message in a database (i.e., the agent's mail box).

    Author:
    K.Hindriks
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • SendAction

        public SendAction(Selector selector,
          SentenceMood mood,
          DatabaseFormula content,
          InputStreamPosition source)
        Creates a SendAction that sends a message (content) to one or more agents.
        Parameters:
        selector - The Selector of this action, indicating where the message should be send to.
        mood - The SentenceMood of the message.
        content - The content of the message.
        source - The source code location of this action, if available; null otherwise.

      • getFreeVar

        public java.util.Set<Var> getFreeVar()
        Returns the (free) variables that occur in the content of the message to be sent by this SendAction and the selector of this action.
        Specified by:
        getFreeVar in class Action
        Returns:
        The (free) variables that occur in the selector and message content of the action.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Checks whether send(once) action is considered closed. This is the case if the selector is closed and if the message is considered closed. The latter is the case if either the message does not contain any (free) variables or the message is of type interrogative, i.e., a question. See: Message.isClosed().
        Overrides:
        isClosed in class Action
        Returns:
        true if the send(once) action is considered closed; false otherwise.

      • applySubst

        public SendAction applySubst(Substitution substitution)
        Applies the given Substitution to this SendAction by applying the substitution to the message content to be sent and to the Selector of this SendAction.
        Specified by:
        applySubst in class Action
        Parameters:
        substitution - The substitution to be applied to the action.
        Returns:
        The instantiated adopt action where (free) variables that are bound by the substitution have been instantiated by the corresponding terms in the substitution.

      • getPrecondition

        public MentalStateCond getPrecondition(KRlanguage language)
                                throws GOALParseException
        The precondition of a SendAction is true, or, to be more precise "bel(true)"; this means it can always be performed if the action is closed.
        Specified by:
        getPrecondition in class Action
        Parameters:
        language - The KR language used for representing the precondition.
        Returns:
        The MentalStateCond "bel(true)".
        Throws:
        GOALParseException - In case the KR parser had a problem parsing "true".

      • evaluatePrecondition

        public SendAction evaluatePrecondition(MentalState mentalState,
                              Debugger debugger,
                              boolean last)
        Checks whether the precondition of SendAction holds. See also: getPrecondition(KRlanguage).
        Specified by:
        evaluatePrecondition in class Action
        Parameters:
        mentalState - The MentalState in which the precondition is evaluated.
        debugger - The current debugger
        last - If this is the last possible variation we are trying to execute, e.g. after this there are no more possibilities and the action will fail.
        Returns:
        This action if a non-empty set of receivers are associated with the message; null otherwise.

      • determineReceivers

        public java.util.Set<AgentId> determineReceivers(MentalState mentalState,
                                        Debugger debugger)
        Returns the list of agent names that should receive the message.
        Parameters:
        mentalState - The MentalState in which the action is executed.
        debugger - The current debugger
        Returns:
        A list of agents that should receive the message.

      • executeAction

        protected Result executeAction(RunState<?> runState,
                   Debugger debugger)
        Executes this SendAction.

        First computes the set of agents that should receive the message by resolving the Selector and then constructs a Message for each agent that should receive the message. For each message constructed a corresponding 'sent' record is inserted into the mail box of the sender.

        Finally sends the messages.

        Specified by:
        executeAction in class Action
        Parameters:
        runState - The RunState in which the action is executed.
        debugger - The current debugger.
        Returns:
        The action that has been executed; never returns null but throws runtime exceptions if executing the action fails.
